text: Kenneth Waltz (1924-2013) is an American political scientist. He created Neorealism in international relations. He got his MA in 1950 and his PhD in political science from Columbia University in 1954. He taught at Columbia University and the University of California, Berkeley. His book International Political Theory (1979) is one of the most influential and highly cited works in international relations. ==References== Category:1924 births Category:American political scientists Category:2013 deaths Category:Columbia University faculty Category:University of California, Berkeley faculty
title: Kenneth Waltz
